definition: classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc

sentences.english: Hou mother decided mourning together happy do not bribe, and inspector put gold father.
sentences.chinese: 侯母決定喪事喜事一起辦，並買通巡長暫不放金父。

sentences.english: The Scot admitted he bribed a cabbie in Bangkok to let him get behind the wheel.
sentences.chinese: 蘇格蘭人承認買通了一個出租司機叫他坐到後座去。

sentences.english: You can buy a man with gold, but only blood and steel will keep him true.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用錢買通，但只有鐵血才能讓他心服口服。

sentences.english: Somebody paid him to do that, and I'm going to find out who it was.
sentences.chinese: 有人買通他這麼做，我要揪出來那人是誰。

sentences.english: The group of stowaway crossed the border by greasing the palms of border guards.
sentences.chinese: 偷渡團伙買通邊防警衛，偷渡國境。

sentences.english: Woman , woman , thou are accountable for this.
sentences.chinese: 這個女人是她的心腹，給斯丹恩買通了的。
